org.apache.ambari.server.configuration

Class Configuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ambari.server.configuration.Configuration

  • public class Configuration
extends Object
    The Configuration class is used to read from the {{ambari.properties}} file and manage/expose the configuration properties. Each property is wrapped in a Configuration.ConfigurationProperty type, allowing the coupling of the key, default value, and type.

    The main(String[]) method can be invoked to produce Markdown of all of the properties, along with their default values and descriptions. This should be done for every release so that the documentation of the configuration properties can be kept current. The index_template.md file is used to generate the markdown.

    The markdown can also be generated by running the site phase in maven or by running the exec:java goal directly: 

     mvn site
 mvn exec:java
 mvn exec:java@configuration-markdown (on maven 3.3.1 and later)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<T>
      The Configuration.ConfigurationProperty class is used to wrap an Ambari property key, type, and default value.
      static class  Configuration.ConnectionPoolType
      The Configuration.ConnectionPoolType is used to define which pooling mechanism JDBC should use.
      static class  Configuration.DatabaseType
      The Configuration.DatabaseType enum represents the database being used.
      static class  Configuration.LdapUsernameCollisionHandlingBehavior
      Ldap username collision handling behavior.

      • CLIENT_API_SSL_KSTR_DIR_NAME

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<String> CLIENT_API_SSL_KSTR_DIR_NAME
        The location on the Ambari server where the REST API keystore and password files are stored if using SSL.

      • CLIENT_API_SSL_KSTR_NAME

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<String> CLIENT_API_SSL_KSTR_NAME
        The name of the keystore used when the Ambari Server REST API is protected by SSL.

      • CLIENT_API_SSL_KSTR_TYPE

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<String> CLIENT_API_SSL_KSTR_TYPE
        The type of the keystore file specified in CLIENT_API_SSL_KSTR_NAME. By default self-signed certificates are used and we can use keystore as truststore in PKCS12 format. When CA signed certificates are used truststore should be created in JKS format (truststore.jks)

      • CLIENT_API_SSL_TSTR_NAME

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<String> CLIENT_API_SSL_TSTR_NAME
        The name of the truststore used when the Ambari Server REST API is protected by SSL.

      • CLIENT_API_SSL_TSTR_TYPE

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<String> CLIENT_API_SSL_TSTR_TYPE
        The type of the keystore file specified in CLIENT_API_SSL_KSTR_NAME. By default self-signed certificates are used and we can use keystore as truststore in PKCS12 format. When CA signed certificates are used truststore should be created in JKS format (truststore.jks)

      • CLIENT_API_SSL_CRT_PASS_FILE_NAME

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<String> CLIENT_API_SSL_CRT_PASS_FILE_NAME
        The filename which contains the password for the keystores, truststores, and certificates for the REST API when it's protected by SSL.

      • CLIENT_API_SSL_CRT_PASS

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<String> CLIENT_API_SSL_CRT_PASS
        The password for the keystores, truststores, and certificates for the REST API when it's protected by SSL. If not specified, then SRVR_CRT_PASS_FILE should be used.

      • STACK_UPGRADE_BYPASS_PRECHECKS

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<Boolean> STACK_UPGRADE_BYPASS_PRECHECKS
        Determines whether pre-upgrade checks will be skipped when performing a stack upgrade.

      • STACK_UPGRADE_AUTO_RETRY_TIMEOUT_MINS

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<Integer> STACK_UPGRADE_AUTO_RETRY_TIMEOUT_MINS
        If a host is shutdown or ambari-agent is stopped, then Ambari Server will still keep waiting til the task timesout, say 10-20 mins. If the host comes back online and ambari-agent is started, then need this retry property to be greater; ideally, it should be greater than 2 * command_timeout in order to retry at least 3 times in that amount of mins. Suggested value is 15-30 mins.

      • STACK_UPGRADE_AUTO_RETRY_CHECK_INTERVAL_SECS

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<Integer> STACK_UPGRADE_AUTO_RETRY_CHECK_INTERVAL_SECS
        If the stack.upgrade.auto.retry.timeout.mins property is positive, then run RetryUpgradeActionService every x seconds.

      • STACK_UPGRADE_AUTO_RETRY_CUSTOM_COMMAND_NAMES_TO_IGNORE

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<String> STACK_UPGRADE_AUTO_RETRY_CUSTOM_COMMAND_NAMES_TO_IGNORE
        If auto-retry during stack upgrade is enabled, skip any tasks whose custom command name contains at least one of the strings in the following CSV property. Note that values have to be enclosed in quotes and separated by commas.

      • STACK_UPGRADE_AUTO_RETRY_COMMAND_DETAILS_TO_IGNORE

        If auto-retry during stack upgrade is enabled, skip any tasks whose command details contains at least one of the strings in the following CSV property. Note that values have to be enclosed in quotes and separated by commas.

        The type of connection pool to use with JDBC connections to the database.

      • SERVER_JDBC_CONNECTION_POOL_MIN_SIZE

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<Integer> SERVER_JDBC_CONNECTION_POOL_MIN_SIZE
        The minimum number of connections that should always exist in the database connection pool. Only used with Configuration.ConnectionPoolType.C3P0.

      • SERVER_JDBC_CONNECTION_POOL_MAX_SIZE

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<Integer> SERVER_JDBC_CONNECTION_POOL_MAX_SIZE
        The maximum number of connections that should exist in the database connection pool. Only used with Configuration.ConnectionPoolType.C3P0.

      • SERVER_JDBC_CONNECTION_POOL_AQUISITION_SIZE

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<Integer> SERVER_JDBC_CONNECTION_POOL_AQUISITION_SIZE
        The number of connections that should be retrieved when the pool size must increase. It's wise to set this higher than 1 since the assumption is that a pool that needs to grow should probably grow by more than 1. Only used with Configuration.ConnectionPoolType.C3P0.

      • SERVER_JDBC_CONNECTION_POOL_MAX_AGE

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<Integer> SERVER_JDBC_CONNECTION_POOL_MAX_AGE
        The maximum amount of time in TimeUnit.SECONDS any connection, whether its been idle or active, should even be in the pool. This will terminate the connection after the expiration age and force new connections to be opened. Only used with Configuration.ConnectionPoolType.C3P0.

      • SERVER_JDBC_CONNECTION_POOL_MAX_IDLE_TIME

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<Integer> SERVER_JDBC_CONNECTION_POOL_MAX_IDLE_TIME
        The maximum amount of time in TimeUnit.SECONDS that an idle connection can remain in the pool. This should always be greater than the value returned from getConnectionPoolMaximumExcessIdle(). Only used with Configuration.ConnectionPoolType.C3P0.

      • SERVER_JDBC_CONNECTION_POOL_MAX_IDLE_TIME_EXCESS

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<Integer> SERVER_JDBC_CONNECTION_POOL_MAX_IDLE_TIME_EXCESS
        The maximum amount of time in TimeUnit.SECONDS that connections beyond the minimum pool size should remain in the pool. This should always be less than than the value returned from getConnectionPoolMaximumIdle(). Only used with Configuration.ConnectionPoolType.C3P0.

      • SERVER_JDBC_CONNECTION_POOL_IDLE_TEST_INTERVAL

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<Integer> SERVER_JDBC_CONNECTION_POOL_IDLE_TEST_INTERVAL
        The number of TimeUnit.SECONDS in between testing each idle connection in the connection pool for validity. Only used with Configuration.ConnectionPoolType.C3P0.

      • SERVER_JDBC_CONNECTION_POOL_ACQUISITION_RETRY_ATTEMPTS

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<Integer> SERVER_JDBC_CONNECTION_POOL_ACQUISITION_RETRY_ATTEMPTS
        The number of times connections should be retried to be acquired from the database before giving up. Only used with Configuration.ConnectionPoolType.C3P0.

      • SERVER_JDBC_CONNECTION_POOL_ACQUISITION_RETRY_DELAY

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<Integer> SERVER_JDBC_CONNECTION_POOL_ACQUISITION_RETRY_DELAY
        The delay in TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS between connection acquisition attempts. Only used with Configuration.ConnectionPoolType.C3P0.

      • VIEW_EXTRACT_AFTER_CLUSTER_CONFIG

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<Boolean> VIEW_EXTRACT_AFTER_CLUSTER_CONFIG
        Property driving the view extraction. It only applies to blueprint deployments. If set to TRUE on ambari-server startup only the system views are loaded; non-system views are extracted upon a cluster creation request is received and the cluster configuration is successfully performed It is advised to use this property only in cases when ambari-server startup time is critical (eg. cloud environments) By default this is FALSE so all views are extracted and deployed at server startup.

      • COMMAND_EXECUTION_TYPE

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<String> COMMAND_EXECUTION_TYPE
        In case this is set to DEPENDENCY_ORDERED one stage is created for each request and command dependencies are handled directly by ActionScheduler. In case of STAGE (which is the default) one or more stages are created depending on dependencies.

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<Integer> METRIC_RETRIEVAL_SERVICE_THREADPOOL_WORKER_QUEUE_SIZE
        The size of the worker queue for the MetricsRetrievalService. The larger this queue is, the less likely it will be to create more threads beyond the core size.

      • METRIC_RETRIEVAL_SERVICE_REQUEST_TTL_ENABLED

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<Boolean> METRIC_RETRIEVAL_SERVICE_REQUEST_TTL_ENABLED
        true to enable a TTL per request made by the MetricsRetrievalService. Enabling this property will prevent requests to the same URL endpoint within a fixed amount of time allowing requests to be throttled.

      • METRIC_RETRIEVAL_SERVICE_REQUEST_TTL

        public static final Configuration.ConfigurationProperty<Integer> METRIC_RETRIEVAL_SERVICE_REQUEST_TTL
        The amount of time, in TimeUnit.SECONDS, that requests to the same URL by the MetricsRetrievalService must be separated. Requests to the same URL which are too close together will not result in metrics retrieval. This property is used to throttle requests to the same URL being made too close together.

      • getStrictTransportSecurityHTTPResponseHeader

        public String getStrictTransportSecurityHTTPResponseHeader()
        Get the value that should be set for the Strict-Transport-Security HTTP response header for Ambari Server UI.

        By default this will be max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains. For example:

        Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains

        This value may be ignored when getApiSSLAuthentication() is false.

        Returns:
        the Strict-Transport-Security value - null or "" indicates that the value is not set

      • getXFrameOptionsHTTPResponseHeader

        public String getXFrameOptionsHTTPResponseHeader()
        Get the value that should be set for the X-Frame-Options HTTP response header for Ambari Server UI.

        By default this will be DENY. For example:

        X-Frame-Options: DENY

        Returns:
        the X-Frame-Options value - null or "" indicates that the value is not set

      • getXXSSProtectionHTTPResponseHeader

        X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block

        Returns:
        the X-XSS-Protection value - null or "" indicates that the value is not set

      • getViewsAdditionalClasspath

        public String getViewsAdditionalClasspath()
        Get the comma separated additional classpath, that should be added to view's classloader.

        By default it will be empty. i.e. no additional classpath. If present it will be comma separated path entries. Each entry can be a file or a directory. If entry is a file it will be added as it is. If entry is a directory, all the files inside this directory will be added to the classpath.

        Returns:
        the view's additional classpath value - null or "" indicates that the value is not set

      • isMasterKeyPersisted

        public boolean isMasterKeyPersisted()

      • getServerKeyStoreDirectory

        public File getServerKeyStoreDirectory()

      • getMasterKeyLocation

        public File getMasterKeyLocation()
        Returns a File pointing where master key file is expected to be

        The master key file is named 'master'. The directory that this file is to be found in is calculated by obtaining the directory path assigned to the Ambari property 'security.master.key.location'; else if that value is empty, then the directory is determined by calling getServerKeyStoreDirectory().

        If it exists, this file contains the key used to decrypt values stored in the master keystore.

        Returns:
        a File that points to the master key file
        See Also:
        getServerKeyStoreDirectory(), MASTER_KEY_FILENAME_DEFAULT

      • getMasterKeyStoreLocation

        public File getMasterKeyStoreLocation()
        Returns the location of the master keystore file.

        The master keystore file is named 'credentials.jceks'. The directory that this file is to be found in is calculated by obtaining the directory path assigned to the Ambari property 'security.master.keystore.location'; else if that value is empty, then the directory is determined by calling getServerKeyStoreDirectory().

        The location is calculated by obtaining the Ambari property directory path assigned to the key 'security.master.keystore.location'. If that value is empty, then the directory is determined by getServerKeyStoreDirectory().

        Returns:
        a File that points to the master keystore file
        See Also:
        getServerKeyStoreDirectory(), MASTER_KEYSTORE_FILENAME_DEFAULT

      • getTemporaryKeyStoreRetentionMinutes

        public long getTemporaryKeyStoreRetentionMinutes()
        Gets the temporary keystore retention time in minutes.

        This value is retrieved from the Ambari property named 'security.temporary.keystore.retention.minutes'. If not set, the default value of 90 (minutes) will be returned.

        Returns:
        a timeout value (in minutes)

      • isActivelyPurgeTemporaryKeyStore

        public boolean isActivelyPurgeTemporaryKeyStore()
        Gets a boolean value indicating whether to actively purge the temporary keystore when the retention time expires (true) or to passively purge when credentials are queried (false).

        This value is retrieved from the Ambari property named 'security.temporary.keystore.actibely.purge'. If not set, the default value of true.

        Returns:
        a Boolean value declaring whether to actively (true) or passively (false) purge the temporary keystore

      • getDatabaseCustomProperties

        public Properties getDatabaseCustomProperties()
        Gets all properties that begin with "server.jdbc.properties." , removing the prefix. The properties are then pre-pending with eclipselink.jdbc.property. before being returned.

        These properties are used to pass JDBC driver-specific connection properties to EclipseLink.

        server.jdbc.properties.loginTimeout -> eclipselink.jdbc.property.loginTimeout
        server.jdbc.properties.oraclecustomname -> eclipselink.jdbc.property.oraclecustomname

        Returns:
        custom properties for database connections

      • getPersistenceCustomProperties

        public Properties getPersistenceCustomProperties()
        Gets all properties that begin with "server.persistence.properties." , removing the prefix. These properties are used to pass JPA-specific properties to the persistence provider (such as EclipseLink).

        server.persistence.properties.eclipselink.jdbc.batch-writing.size=25 -> eclipselink.jdbc.batch-writing.size=25

        Returns:
        custom properties for database connections

      • getHostRoleCommandStatusSummaryCacheEnabled

        public boolean getHostRoleCommandStatusSummaryCacheEnabled()
        Caching of host role command status summary can be enabled/disabled through the SERVER_HRC_STATUS_SUMMARY_CACHE_ENABLED config property. This method returns the value of SERVER_HRC_STATUS_SUMMARY_CACHE_ENABLED config property.
        Returns:
        true if caching is to be enabled otherwise false.

      • getHostRoleCommandStatusSummaryCacheSize

        public long getHostRoleCommandStatusSummaryCacheSize()
        In order to avoid the cache storing host role command status summary objects exhaust memory we set a max record number allowed for the cache. This limit can be configured through SERVER_HRC_STATUS_SUMMARY_CACHE_SIZE config property. The method returns the value of this config property.
        Returns:
        the upper limit for the number of cached host role command summaries.

      • getHostRoleCommandStatusSummaryCacheExpiryDuration

        public long getHostRoleCommandStatusSummaryCacheExpiryDuration()
        As a safety measure the cache storing host role command status summaries should auto expire after a while. The expiry duration is specified through the SERVER_HRC_STATUS_SUMMARY_CACHE_EXPIRY_DURATION config property expressed in minutes. The method returns the value of this config property.
        Returns:
        the cache expiry duration in minutes

      • getConnectionPoolType

        public Configuration.ConnectionPoolType getConnectionPoolType()
        Gets the type of connection pool that EclipseLink should use.
        Returns:
        default of Configuration.ConnectionPoolType.INTERNAL.

      • getConnectionPoolMinimumSize

        public int getConnectionPoolMinimumSize()
        Gets the minimum number of connections that should always exist in the connection pool.

      • getConnectionPoolMaximumSize

        public int getConnectionPoolMaximumSize()
        Gets the maximum number of connections that should even exist in the connection pool.

      • getConnectionPoolMaximumAge

        public int getConnectionPoolMaximumAge()
        Gets the maximum amount of time in seconds any connection, whether its been idle or active, should even be in the pool. This will terminate the connection after the expiration age and force new connections to be opened.

      • getConnectionPoolMaximumIdle

        public int getConnectionPoolMaximumIdle()
        Gets the maximum amount of time in seconds that an idle connection can remain in the pool. This should always be greater than the value returned from getConnectionPoolMaximumExcessIdle()

      • getConnectionPoolMaximumExcessIdle

        public int getConnectionPoolMaximumExcessIdle()
        Gets the maximum amount of time in seconds that connections beyond the minimum pool size should remain in the pool. This should always be less than than the value returned from getConnectionPoolMaximumIdle()

      • getConnectionPoolAcquisitionSize

        public int getConnectionPoolAcquisitionSize()
        Gets the number of connections that should be retrieved when the pool size must increase. It's wise to set this higher than 1 since the assumption is that a pool that needs to grow should probably grow by more than 1.

      • getConnectionPoolAcquisitionRetryAttempts

        public int getConnectionPoolAcquisitionRetryAttempts()
        Gets the number of times connections should be retried to be acquired from the database before giving up.

      • getConnectionPoolAcquisitionRetryDelay

        public int getConnectionPoolAcquisitionRetryDelay()
        Gets the delay in milliseconds between connection acquire attempts.

      • getConnectionPoolIdleTestInternval

        public int getConnectionPoolIdleTestInternval()
        Gets the number of seconds in between testing each idle connection in the connection pool for validity.

      • isAlertCacheEnabled

        public boolean isAlertCacheEnabled()
        If true, then alerts processed by the AlertReceivedListener will not write alert data to the database on every event. Instead, data like timestamps and text will be kept in a cache and flushed out periodically to the database.

        The default value is false.

        Returns:
        true if the cache is enabled, false otherwise.

      • getAlertCacheFlushInterval

        public int getAlertCacheFlushInterval()
        Gets the interval at which cached alert data is written out to the database, if enabled.

      • getMetricsServiceCacheTimeout

        public int getMetricsServiceCacheTimeout()
        Gets the number of minutes that data cached by the MetricsRetrievalService is kept. The longer this value is, the older the data will be when a user first logs in. After that first login, data will be updated by the MetricsRetrievalService as long as incoming REST requests are made.

        It is recommended that this value be longer rather than shorter since the performance benefit of the cache greatly outweighs the data loaded after first login.

        Returns:
        the number of minutes, defaulting to 30 if not specified.

      • getMetricsServiceThreadPriority

        public int getMetricsServiceThreadPriority()
        Gets the priority of the Threads used by the MetricsRetrievalService. This will be a value within the range of Thread.MIN_PRIORITY and Thread.MAX_PRIORITY.
        Returns:
        the thread proprity.

      • getMetricsServiceThreadPoolCoreSize

        public int getMetricsServiceThreadPoolCoreSize()
        Gets the core pool size used for the MetricsRetrievalService.

      • getMetricsServiceThreadPoolMaxSize

        public int getMetricsServiceThreadPoolMaxSize()
        Gets the max pool size used for the MetricsRetrievalService. Threads will only be increased up to this value of the worker queue is exhausted and rejects the new task.
        See Also:
        getMetricsServiceWorkerQueueSize()

      • getMetricsServiceWorkerQueueSize

        public int getMetricsServiceWorkerQueueSize()
        Gets the queue size of the worker queue for the MetricsRetrievalService.
        Returns:
        the worker queue size, or 10 * getMetricsServiceThreadPoolMaxSize() if not specified.

      • getMetricsServiceRequestTTL

        public int getMetricsServiceRequestTTL()
        Gets the number of seconds that requests made to the same URL will be discarded in order to throttle the retrieval from the same endpoint.
        Returns:
        the number of seconds that must elapse between requests to the same endpoint.

      • isMetricsServiceRequestTTLCacheEnabled

        public boolean isMetricsServiceRequestTTLCacheEnabled()
        Gets whether the TTL request cache in the MetricsRetrievalService is enabled. This evicting cache is used to prevent requests to the same URL within a specified amount of time.
        Returns:
        true if enabled, false otherwise.
